title: 110_s1677

Step 4 - 
No summarized chunk to provide. The term 'joint resolution' refers to a resolution introduced within a specific timeframe after receiving a report related to currency manipulation, disapproving the Secretary of the Treasury's determination. The term 'joint resolution' refers to a resolution introduced within a specific timeframe after receiving a report related to currency manipulation, disapproving the Secretary of the Treasury's determination. The procedures for considering resolutions involve original resolutions originating from specific committees in the House of Representatives and the Senate, with floor consideration following specific guidelines. The provisions of subsections (d) through (f) of section 152 of the Trade Act of 1974 apply to a joint resolution of disapproval under this section. Section 152(f) of the Trade Act of 1974 is modified by substituting certain language in paragraph (2). The Congress enacts rules for the House of Representatives and Senate as part of the Exchange Rates and International Economic Policy Coordination Act of 1988, superseding inconsistent rules. The Congress has the constitutional right to change rules for the House of Representatives and Senate at any time, similar to any other rule of that House. The Financial Reports Act of 1988, also known as the Promoting Market Access for Financial Services Act, requires a report on how foreign countries treat US financial institutions. The Financial Reports Act of 1988 is amended to require annual reports starting July 1, 2008, and annually thereafter to the Senate's Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs and the House of Representatives' Committee on Financial Services. Subsections are redesignated and added for clarity. The Secretary must include a summary of the US-China Strategic Economic Dialogue (SED) in the initial report under section 3602. The report should cover the results of the SED related to market access for financial institutions, progress on agreements, challenges, and a plan with benchmarks and timeframes. Specific issues to address include foreign investment rules, dual-share stock market problems, derivatives market openness, and restrictions on foreign bank branching. The initial report must include a summary of the US-China Strategic Economic Dialogue (SED) covering market access for financial institutions, progress on agreements, challenges, and a plan with benchmarks and timeframes. Specific issues include foreign investment rules, dual-share stock market problems, derivatives market openness, and restrictions on foreign bank branching. Additionally, it should address the ability to offer insurance and regulatory transparency.
